channel.title: [Question] How do i remove programs on the start up?
channel.description:
Hey, i have googled this by the way, but i attempt to remove programs from starting up when my computer starts up (i.e. real player....) and other stuff, i am succsessful with this but when i do this, or remove any programs at all from the start up msn will not log me in and i get the error message that my default gateway is not connected or something, all help greatly apreciated.
oh and btw i removed stuff from my start up by going to run>"msconfig">startup then their is a big list of stuff that is set to run on start up, deselected all the things i didnt want, then started up msn didnt work.. removed just 1 thing, booted up and msn wouldnt work (Same error message) began again selecting 1 other thing to not run on start up while running the other 1 that i previously had not ran (if you can stay with me here) and i still recieved the same error message, i did this all about a week ago but havent had the time to ask for help. thanks.

item.title: [Question] How do i remove programs on the start up?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I have always used HiJackThis when I suspect a virus on my computer. One of the best tools there is in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: [Question] How do i remove programs on the start up?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Take a look at Hijack This: http://www.merijn.org/ - It’s a great utility, but be sure to only touch the startup values unless yo’re sure what you’re deleting/disabling

Read full topic

item.title: [Question] How do i remove programs on the start up?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok, download CCleaner(it’s a simple cleaner of browser caches and stuff but I’m lazy and it cleans so much :p), go to tools, startup and then you can see the list of stuff on startup with the path of the program. It’s completly free, safe and is being updated all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: [Question] How do i remove programs on the start up?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Try reenabling the processes you disabled from starting up. Maybeyou disabled the wrong one? If all else fails, you could always do a system restore.

Read full topic
